## Utils

Utils is a set of common utility functions that we use throughout our library code that are made available to you for your AEK screen code. We have ported a number of functions from lodash:

* [all / every](https://lodash.com/docs/3#every)
* [bindAll](https://lodash.com/docs/3#bindAll)
* [chain](https://lodash.com/docs/3#chain)
* [chunk](https://lodash.com/docs/3#chunk)
* [clone](https://lodash.com/docs/3#clone)
* [cloneDeep](https://lodash.com/docs/3#cloneDeep)
* [contains / includes](https://lodash.com/docs/3#includes)
* [countBy](https://lodash.com/docs/3#countBy)
* [debounce](https://lodash.com/docs/3#debounce)
* [defer](https://lodash.com/docs/3#defer)
* [difference](https://lodash.com/docs/3#difference)
* [each / forEach](https://lodash.com/docs/3#forEach)
* [escape](https://lodash.com/docs/3#escape)
* [extend](https://lodash.com/docs/3#extend)
* [filter](https://lodash.com/docs/3#filter)
* [find](https://lodash.com/docs/3#find)
* [findIndex](https://lodash.com/docs/3#findIndex)
* [findWhere](https://lodash.com/docs/3#findWhere)
* [first](https://lodash.com/docs/3#first)
* [flatten](https://lodash.com/docs/3#flatten)
* [flattenDeep](https://lodash.com/docs/3#flattenDeep)
* [get](https://lodash.com/docs/3#get)
* [groupBy](https://lodash.com/docs/3#groupBy)
* [has](https://lodash.com/docs/3#has)
* [indexBy](https://lodash.com/docs/3#indexBy)
* [indexOf](https://lodash.com/docs/3#indexOf)
* [initial](https://lodash.com/docs/3#initial)
* [intersection](https://lodash.com/docs/3#intersection)
* [isArray](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isArray)
* [isBoolean](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isBoolean)
* [isDate](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isDate)
* [isElement](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isElement)
* [isEmpty](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isEmpty)
* [isEqual](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isEqual)
* [isFunction](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isFunction)
* [isNaN](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isNaN)
* [isNumber](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isNumber)
* [isObject](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isObject)
* [isPlainObject](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isPlainObject)
* [isString](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isString)
* [isUndefined](https://lodash.com/docs/3#isUndefined)
* [keys](https://lodash.com/docs/3#keys)
* [last](https://lodash.com/docs/3#last)
* [map](https://lodash.com/docs/3#map)
* [mapValues](https://lodash.com/docs/3#mapValues)
* [max](https://lodash.com/docs/3#max)
* [merge](https://lodash.com/docs/3#merge)
* [min](https://lodash.com/docs/3#min)
* [omit](https://lodash.com/docs/3#omit)
* [once](https://lodash.com/docs/3#once)
* [pick](https://lodash.com/docs/3#pick)
* [pluck](https://lodash.com/docs/3#pluck)
* [pull](https://lodash.com/docs/3#pull)
* [random](https://lodash.com/docs/3#random)
* [range](https://lodash.com/docs/3#range)
* [reduce](https://lodash.com/docs/3#reduce)
* [reject](https://lodash.com/docs/3#reject)
* [remove](https://lodash.com/docs/3#remove)
* [rest](https://lodash.com/docs/3#rest)
* [set](https://lodash.com/docs/3#set)
* [sample](https://lodash.com/docs/3#sample)
* [shuffle](https://lodash.com/docs/3#shuffle)
* [some](https://lodash.com/docs/3#some)
* [sortBy](https://lodash.com/docs/3#sortBy)
* [sortedIndex](https://lodash.com/docs/3#sortedIndex)
* [template](https://lodash.com/docs/3#template)
* [throttle](https://lodash.com/docs/3#throttle)
* [times](https://lodash.com/docs/3#times)
* [unescape](https://lodash.com/docs/3#unescape)
* [union](https://lodash.com/docs/3#union)
* [uniq](https://lodash.com/docs/3#uniq)
* [uniqueId](https://lodash.com/docs/3#uniqueId)
* [values](https://lodash.com/docs/3#values)
* [where](https://lodash.com/docs/3#where)
* [without](https://lodash.com/docs/3#without)


In addition to this there are a number of utils provided specifically for AEK development

### `Utils.currentURL(): string`
Returns the current URL

### `Utils.fuse(object: Object, [...sources: Object]): Object`
Like `_.merge` but simply replaces arrays instead of trying to merge them

### `Utils.getBodyDataAttribute(key: string): string`
Returns a value if defined in the AEK template data

### `Utils.getEnv(): string`
In AEK environment this should return "prod" or "dev"

### `Utils.getEnvironment(): string`
Same as above

### `Utils.getPackageData(): Object`
Returns package data for the working package (name, version, etc)

### `Utils.getPackageName(): string`
Returns the name of the current package

### `Utils.getPlatform(): string`
Should return "web", "ios" or "android"

### `Utils.getWindowDimensions(): {width: number,height: number}`
Get dimensions of window

### `Utils.isDev(): boolean`
Returns `true` if running in dev environment

### `Utils.isNative(): boolean`
Returns `true` if platform is "ios" or "android"

### `Utils.isReactComponent(object: any): boolean`
Returns true if the object is a React component

### `Utils.isWeb(): boolean`
Returns `true` if platform is web

### `Utils.normaliseError(error: any): Error`
Returns an error from any given object. If the object is already an error - it'll just return itself

### `Utils.outerHeight(el: DOMElement): number`
Get the outer height (including margin) of an element

### `Utils.outerWidth(el: DOMElement): number`
Get the outer width (including margin) of an element

### `Utils.param(obj: Object): string`
Parameter serializer adapteed from jQuery.param

### `Utils.parseQueryString(str: string): Object`
Parse a query string and return an object representation

### `Utils.plate(template: string, obj: Object, opts: Object): string`
Like `_.template` but offers some support for undefined variables

### `Utils.titleCase(str: string): string`
Converts the given string to title case

### `Utils.validateEmail(email: string): boolean`
Test to see if the given string is a valid email

### `Utils.validateTel(tel: string): boolean`
Test to see if the given string is a valid telephone number
